docs.snippet: Robert H. Kenmore wears a Valentino belt, a $250 Cartier love bracelet and says that he personally has no interest in fashion. The belt and the bracelet are legitimate business props for the man who calls himself a paper shuffler and a traditional...
docs.lead_paragraph: Robert H. Kenmore wears a Valentino belt, a $250 Cartier love bracelet and says that he personally has no interest in fashion. The belt and the bracelet are legitimate business props for the man who calls himself a paper shuffler and a traditionalist in clothes.

headline.main: Behind Some Designer Labels, Fashion Conglomerates Prosper

docs.snippet: MIAMI BEACH, Jan. 14 -Floyd Patterson, the former two-time world heavyweight champion, will resume his comeback tomorrow night against Levi Forte, a 30-yearold bellhop at the Fontainebleau Hotel here who has been inactive as a boxer for 13 months....

docs.snippet: ST. PAUL, Jan. 13 -- The Minnesota Supreme Court ruled today that Lieut. Gov. Rudolph G. Perpich exceeded his constitutional powers when, in presiding over the State Senate, he made parliamentary decisions that gave control of the upper house to h...
docs.lead_paragraph: ST. PAUL, Jan. 13 -- The Minnesota Supreme Court ruled today that Lieut. Gov. Rudolph G. Perpich exceeded his constitutional powers when, in presiding over the State Senate, he made parliamentary decisions that gave control of the upper house to his own Democratic-Farmer-Labor party.
docs.abstract: Minn Sup Ct rules Lt Gov Perpich exceeded const powers as state Sen presiding officer in making parliamentary decisions that recently gave control to own Dem-Farmer-Labor party; rules he had no power to break tie or to refuse seat to Conservative Sen Palmer; decision puts Repub-oriented Conservatives in position to take over Sen control by apptg coms and com chmn when session resumes; Palmer role as key figure in dispute, clash during Sen opening session revd

headline.main: MINNESOTA COURT REALIGNS SENATE; Shifts Control From D.F.L. to Conservative Caucus
